conclusion: Determine which blocks A will collide with and where it will eventually stop.
A is moving from the group of blocks on the right. The blocks on the right are colored green, yellow, blue, orange, and purple.
A is moving towards the left side of the image. The blocks on the left are colored red, blue, orange, and purple.
A will collide with the red block on the left side of the image.
The red block is deflected by the green blocks on the left side of the image, so A will not collide with the red block directly but will pass through it.
After colliding with the red block, A will continue moving towards the left side of the image, and the green blocks will prevent it from reaching the orange and purple blocks.
A will collide with the red block, pass through it, and continue moving towards the orange and purple blocks on the left side.
